item.title: Strobogrammatic Number
item.description: A strobogrammatic number is a number that looks the same when rotated 180 degrees (looked at upside down). Write a function to determine if a number is strobogrammatic. The number is represented as a string. Example 1: Input: "69" Output: true Example 2: Input: "88" Output: true Example 3: Input: "962" Output: false Solution class Solution: def isStrobogrammatic(self, num: str) -> bool: pairs = { 1: 1, 6: 9, 8: 8, 9: 6, 0: 0 } mid = len(num)//2+1 for i in range(mid): leftNum = int(num[i]) rightNum = int(num[-i-1]) if leftNum not in pairs or pairs[leftNum] !
